alert.note: Alert for Southeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 4:25PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BERG GLACIER DAMMED LAKE IS RELEASING AND COULD CAUSE HIGH WATER IN CONTROLLER BAY AND NEARBY COASTAL WATERS... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova has released at some point between August 8th and 15th. This lake releases downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. Though a volume estimate is impossible, in past events the Bering River has crested seven to eleven feet above baseflow. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for seven days with large areas flooded between Bering and Starodubtsov Lakes. Mariners in the Controller Bay area should anticipate debris in the water as a result of the flooding.
